content: I appreciate the efforts to curb the spread of Covid. However when I turned off my phone's location, I received a notification from Google's Exposure Notifications framework that I needed to enable location in order for the app to work. What??? Covidwise says that "No personal data or location tracking occurs within this app." I've since learned that while the app itself doesn't ask for location, Google's Exposure Notification framework (used by the app) obtains location data by using Bluetooth. content: Kudos to VDH for doing such a good job with this app. The app is lightweight and unobtrusive, and it was designed with privacy in mind. The app is easy to use; you just go through a short setup, and then it runs quietly in the background. Hopefully that's the last you will ever hear of it. If you test positive, you can open up the app and report the test. If another app user that you were exposed to reports a positive test, you will get a notification, and then you know you need to go get tested. That's all there is to it. I see that some reviewers are complaining that it requires GPS, but I'm not sure where they are getting that, since it is patently not true. You can see that much by just checking the app's requested permissions from Android's settings menu. It does, however, require Bluetooth to be turned on, since that's how it detects the presence of other devices. TLDR: this app allows you to keep track of who you were exposed to while going out of its way to make sure that no record of either your movements or theirs is even created, let alone kept. If everyone uses it, then people who are exposed can self-isolate before they have a chance to pass the infection on, and that's a way better way to contain the disease than shutting down civilization. Use it, and you might just save a life, maybe even your own. When was the last time you did that by installing an app?

content: Want to see
A lot of critical reviews are from people who don't understand the technology behind how ENS works.

The people who give poor reviews don't understand the app or are fear mongering. Just like a mask, this app only works if everyone uses it. How the app works in a nutshell: you know when you scan for nearby Bluetooth devices and you see a bunch of devices? That's what this app does. It scans for nearby Bluetooth, records any devices that are in range & *that have a copy of this app*. The app creates a low energy Bluetooth device broadcast ID that can be read only by other app users.

I would definitely use this, except..... Except it is just for Virginia, and I'm in Illinois. But, I understand that a nation-wide method of linking among state departments of health is in the works. There is a really good article in the Washington Post about this app, and that's where I found out about it.

content: This app will save lives.

CovidWISE is the official contact tracing app for Virginia created by Apple and Google (collaboration). It is very well made and trustworthy. It does not use GPS and cannot track your location. It uses Bluetooth to simply detect when you've been near someone that also has the app installed (and their Bluetooth enabled at the time). If someone gets tested positive for covid that you've been near within the past 14 days, CovidWISE will alert you. It is all completely anonymous.

A great concept, doesn't use location data rather Bluetooth interactions in order to tell if you were near someone who submitted positive recently. I hope they continue to push for people to download it because otherwise it'll be ineffective with the amount of people with it downloaded currently
This could really help slow the rise of Covid19 cases- it isn't a tracker, just a notification app. All Virginians should use it!

Incredibly useful and their privacy explanation offers an insight into how the app works. I'm glad that I don't have to enable location services at all for this app, and it doesn't seem to store any identifiable information on my device, for those concerned with privacy.

Clever way to do anonymous proximity tracing by using Bluetooth instead of GPS. For those concerned about privacy... check the app permissions... it doesn't require any access to your location or phone storage, etc. For those giving it a one star review and calling it "stupid"... just because you are too lazy to read about how it works doesn't make the solution stupid. It just makes YOU seem stupid.
This is truly the smartest idea that I have seen yet during this pandemic. Anyone in virginia should get the app especially if you did test positive!

replyContent: People who have downloaded the app are near each other for a period of time, the phones exchange and save their anonymous keys that estimate exposure using the date, time, and the duration of the contact, as well as the strength of the Bluetooth signal to approximate distance. These individuals must not have installed COVIDWISE to share results.

Guys... It uses Bluetooth LE to communicate with nearby devices, that's why it doesn't need location data. Your phone and another device exchange keys (which are randomized and deleted every 14 days) and if that user tests positive, they say so in the app which then notifies everyone their phone exchanged keys with. Please try to understand the technology here and that they're trying to help instead of being conspiracy theorists thinking everyone is out to steal your data.
